greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of partitions of n, where k is the difference between the number of odd parts and the number of even parts; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, -floor(n/2)+(n mod 2)<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..120, flattened
formula: G.f.: 1 / prod(n>=1, 1 - e(n)*q^n ) = 1 + sum(n>=1, e(n)*q^n / prod(k=1..n, 1-e(k)*q^k) ) where e(n) = u if n odd, otherwise 1/u; see Pari program. [_Joerg Arndt_, Mar 31 2014]
maple: T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=ldegree(p)..degree(p)))(b(n$2)):
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i<1, 0, b[n, i-1] + If[i>n, 0, b[n-i, i]*x^(2*Mod[i, 2]-1)]]]; T[n_] := (degree = Exponent[b[n, n], x]; ldegree = -Exponent[b[n, n] /. x -> 1/x, x]; Table[Coefficient[b[n, n], x, i], {i, ldegree, degree}]); Table[T[n], {n, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 06 2015, translated from Maple *)
program: { for (j=1, #V,  \\ print triangle, including leading zeros
xref: Cf. A240021 (the same for partitions into distinct parts), A242618 (the same for parts counted without multiplicity).
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 30 2014
